snippet: Recent events in the contest between President Obama and Mitt Romney have raised new questions about whether the political culture still holds any penalty for falsehood.
abstract: Political Memo; recent events in the contest between Pres Obama and Mitt Romney have raised new questions about the role of dishonesty in political campaigns and whether the political culture still holds any penalty for campaigns that peddle falsehoods.
lead_paragraph: Recent events in the contest between President Obama and Mitt Romney have raised new questions about whether the political culture still holds any penalty for falsehood.

headline.seo: Fact-Checkers Howl, but Both Sides Cling to False Ads
headline.main: Campaigns Play Loose With Truth in a Fact-Check Age
headline.print_headline: Fact-Checkers Howl, but Campaigns Seem Attached to Dishonest Ads
